description: AI-powered coaching system that guides founders from idea to traction using Fred Cary's methodology with silent diagnostics, positioning framework, and investor lens

features.title: Voice Agent with WebSocket Real-Time Communication
features.description: Real-time voice and video communication using LiveKit WebSocket infrastructure with AI-powered voice assistants and human agent handoff

features.title: AI Business Analyst Chat (Sahara-Style Coaching)
features.description: Embedded ChatGPT-style interface for strategic guidance and judgment amplification. Diagnoses before prescribing.

features.title: Founder Decision OS (Fred Cary Coaching System)
features.description: Complete coaching system with 9-step gating process, silent diagnostics, positioning framework, and investor lens

modules.title: Startup Process Engine (9-Step Gating)
modules.description: Gating process from idea to traction - founders cannot advance until current step is validated

steps.name: Decide What Earns Right to Scale

modules.title: Silent Diagnostic System
modules.description: Continuous internal evaluation of positioning clarity and investor readiness - founders don't choose, system diagnoses

phases.name: Universal Entry
phases.behavior: Ask: What are you building? Who is it for? What are you trying to accomplish right now?

phases.name: Selective Introduction
phases.positioningTrigger: ICP unclear, can't explain value crisply, weak traction despite activity
phases.investorTrigger: Founder explicitly discusses fundraising, uploads deck, asks about raising
phases.rule: Introduce only ONE framework at a time

phases.name: Formal Assessments
phases.language: If it's helpful, we can formally pressure-test this using the same criteria investors (or buyers) will use.

modules.title: Positioning Readiness Framework
modules.description: A-F grading system for market clarity, not marketing copy

questions: Can founder explain in one sentence without jargon?
Is target customer specific enough to identify in real world?
Awareness of direct and indirect competitors?
Is problem validated through real customer interaction?
How do customers currently solve this?
Does story feel coherent and compelling?
Would this create curiosity/urgency in buyer?

modules.title: Investor Lens (VC Evaluation Framework)
modules.description: Evaluate companies the way a VC partner would prepare for IC - Pre-Seed, Seed, and Series A only
coreEvaluationAxes: Team (founder-market fit, learning velocity, ability to recruit)
Traction Quality (retention, usage, revenue - not vanity)
Fund Fit (why this investor, why this round, why now)

hiddenVCFilters.meaning: Too small to move the fund
No partner willing to carry conviction
Looks unfamiliar or too familiar in wrong way
No social proof or external validation
Too much work to reach conviction

preSeed.primaryQuestion: Can this team find and earn product-market fit?

output: Scores for traction quality, repeatability, Series A clarity

seriesA.primaryQuestion: Is PMF proven and is growth repeatable?
output: 90-day Series A readiness plan with metric targets

deckRequestProtocol.coreRule: Never ask for a deck by default. Always issue provisional verdict first.
requestDeckWhen: Company is near the line (Not yet, but close)
Founder explicitly asks for deck review
deckRequestProtocol.preSeedLanguage: A deck is likely premature. A 1-2 page summary covering ICP, problem, early evidence, and what you're trying to de-risk would be more useful.
deckRequestProtocol.seedLanguage: You're close enough that a deck could sharpen the investor read. If you want, upload it and I'll review from IC perspective.
deckRequestProtocol.seriesALanguage: At this stage, a deck is the right artifact. I'll review it the way a Series A partner would.

guardrails: Do not encourage fundraising by default
Say plainly when something is not venture-backable
Offer alternatives when VC is wrong for the business
Capital is a tool, not the goal

corePhilosophy.founderDecisionOS: Never optimize downstream artifacts (decks, patents, hiring, fundraising) before upstream truth is established
corePhilosophy.saharaCoaching: Sahara doesn't execute tasks — it sharpens judgment so everything users execute actually works
corePhilosophy.silentDiagnostics: Founders do not choose diagnostics. The system diagnoses silently, then introduces the right lens at the right moment
corePhilosophy.investorLens: This is not a checklist to game investors. It is a framework to help founders understand how VCs actually make decisions

nonNegotiable: Offer alternatives when VC is wrong for business
Capital is a tool, not the goal
Founders stay in control of decisions

successMetrics: 80% of founders complete Step 1-5 before asking about investors
Positioning framework introduced only when warranted
Investor lens introduced only when founder raises topic
90% of founders report feeling 'guided, not evaluated'
Average 6+ messages before any framework introduction
